channel.title: Github Issues on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Github Issues on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Using Github Issues and Waffle.io as a personal kanban board
item.description: I’ve been using Github issues to track my personal todo list for quite some time now, and since November I’ve been using Waffle.io to help that process. Waffle in this use is a view of a series of queues in my todo list. Most everything that I’m not doing now lives in the “backlog” queue, which I try to keep to less than 100 just to keep myself sane. (At more than 100 there’s usually a lot of duplicates; at less than 100 I’m probably not acknowledging that there’s something to be done).

item.title: Some reflection on use of Github as an issue tracker, two weeks in
item.description: Two weeks ago, I started using Github as an issue tracker to keep track of things that I intend to do. So far so good. According to its tally, I've closed 139 issues and have 88 open issues. Here's some reflection on that use. I started up with Github in part because I have an infatuation with new technologies for self-organization, and this was the latest in a series of attempts to get my life in order.
